concepts.title: Div Element
concepts.description: Learn about the div element and how to use it for content division and layout
concepts.explanation: The <div> element is a container that helps organize and group content. It's a block-level element commonly used for layout and styling purposes. Unlike semantic elements, divs have no inherent meaning but serve as versatile containers for structuring content.

concepts.title: Semantic Elements
concepts.description: Understand semantic HTML elements like header, nav, main, article, and footer
concepts.explanation: Semantic HTML elements clearly describe their meaning to both the browser and the developer. They provide better structure, accessibility, and SEO benefits compared to generic div elements. Common semantic elements include <header>, <nav>, <main>, <article>, <section>, <aside>, and <footer>.

concepts.title: Forms & Input Elements
concepts.description: Master HTML forms and various input types for collecting user data
concepts.explanation: HTML forms are essential for collecting user input. The <form> element contains various input elements, each designed for specific types of data. Modern HTML5 input types provide built-in validation and appropriate mobile keyboards.

concepts.title: Tables
concepts.description: Learn how to create and structure tables for displaying data
concepts.explanation: HTML tables are used to present data in rows and columns. They consist of elements like <table>, <tr> (table row), <td> (table data), and <th> (table header). Tables should be used for tabular data, not for layout purposes.

options: To provide a title or explanation

keyPoints: Use tables for tabular data only
Include proper headers with <th>
Use captions for better context
Consider responsive design for tables

concepts.title: Lists
concepts.description: Explore different types of HTML lists and their uses
concepts.explanation: HTML provides three types of lists: ordered lists (<ol>), unordered lists (<ul>), and description lists (<dl>). Lists can be nested and styled to create navigation menus, content hierarchies, and more.
